alert.note: Alert for Dearborn; Fayette; Franklin; Ripley; Union (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 3:48AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF FRANKLIN AND NORTHERN RIPLEY COUNTIES IN SOUTHEASTERN INDIANA, UNION COUNTY IN EAST CENTRAL INDIANA, NORTHERN DEARBORN COUNTY IN SOUTHEASTERN INDIANA, SOUTHERN FAYETTE COUNTY IN EAST CENTRAL INDIANA, NORTHWESTERN HAMILTON COUNTY IN SOUTHWESTERN OHIO, SOUTHWESTERN PREBLE COUNTY IN WEST CENTRAL OHIO AND WESTERN BUTLER COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN OHIO THROUGH 430 AM EDT... At 347 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Rushville, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Oxford, Connersville, Harrison, Batesville, Brookville, Bright, Liberty, West College Corner, Oldenburg, Glenwood, Blue Jay, Darrtown, Lake Santee, Salem, Logan, Reily, New Haven, Blooming Grove, Columbia and Sunman. This includes the following Interstates... I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 145 and 171. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 5. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM EDT for east central Indiana...and west central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
